title: Google\Cloud\Logging\PsrLogger
name: PsrLogger
description: A PSR-3 compliant logger used to write entries to Google Stackdriver Logging.

params.name: logger
params.description: The logger used to write entries.

params.name: messageKey
params.description: The key in the jsonPayload used to contain the logged message. Defaults to message.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.metadataProvider
params.description: Defaults to An automatically chosen provider, based on detected environment settings.

params.name: options.batchEnabled
params.description: Determines whether or not to use background batching. Defaults to false. Note that this option is currently considered experimental and is subject to change.

params.name: options.debugOutput
params.description: Whether or not to output debug information. Defaults to false. Applies only when batchEnabled is set to true.

params.name: options.batchOptions
params.description: A set of options for a BatchJob. Google\Cloud\Core\Batch\BatchJob::__construct() for more details. Defaults to ['batchSize' => 1000, 'callPeriod' => 2.0, 'workerNum' => 2]. Applies only when batchEnabled is set to true.

params.name: options.clientConfig
params.description: Configuration options for the Logging client used to handle processing of batch items. For valid options please see Google\Cloud\Logging\LoggingClient::__construct(). Applies only when batchEnabled is set to true.

params.name: options.batchRunner
params.description: A BatchRunner object. Mainly used for the tests to inject a mock. Defaults to a newly created BatchRunner. Applies only when batchEnabled is set to true.

params.name: message
params.description: The message to log.

params.name: context
params.description: Please see Google\Cloud\Logging\PsrLogger::log() for the available options.

params.name: message
params.description: The message to log.

params.name: context
params.description: Please see Google\Cloud\Logging\PsrLogger::log() for the available options.

params.description: The message to log.

params.name: context

params.name: message

params.name: context
params.description: Please see Google\Cloud\Logging\PsrLogger::log() for the available options.

params.name: message
params.description: The message to log.

params.name: context
params.description: Please see Google\Cloud\Logging\PsrLogger::log() for the available options.

examples.caption: Write a log entry using the context array with placeholders.

params.name: level
params.description: The severity of the log entry.

params.name: message
params.description: The message to log.

params.name: context
params.description: Context is an associative array which can include placeholders to be used in the $message. Placeholders must be delimited with a single opening brace { and a single closing brace }. The context will be added as additional information on the jsonPayload. Please note that the key stackdriverOptions is reserved for logging Google Stackdriver specific data.

params.name: context.stackdriverOptions['resource']
params.description: The monitored resource to associate this log entry with. Defaults to type global.

params.name: context.stackdriverOptions['httpRequest']
params.description: Information about the HTTP request associated with this log entry, if applicable. Please see the API docs for more information.

params.name: context.stackdriverOptions['labels']
params.description: A set of user-defined (key, value) data that provides additional information about the log entry.

params.name: context.stackdriverOptions['operation']
params.description: Additional information about a potentially long-running operation with which a log entry is associated. Please see the API docs for more information.

params.name: context.stackdriverOptions['insertId']
params.description: A unique identifier for the log entry.

params.name: context.stackdriverOptions['timestamp']
params.description: The timestamp associated with this entry. If providing a string it must be in RFC3339 UTC "Zulu" format. Example: "2014-10-02T15:01:23.045123456Z". If explicitly set to null the timestamp will be generated by the server at the moment the entry is received (with nanosecond precision). Defaults to the current time, generated by the client with microsecond precision.
